text:
Appearance: Super creamy tan head with a dense black body. Look very good!

Smell: Surprisingly mute actually. I coaxed out some faint hints of cocoa and charcoal but not much more.

Taste: More charcoal (not harsh) with some coffee, bitter-sweet chocolate and an overall roasted character. Its a little to subtle for my tastes but it gets a little more complex as it warms. Some bitterness at the end, hops maybe? Still, not as rich as i would have liked.

Mouthfeel: Cant really complain here as its oh so smooth. Quite full bodied with a low carbonation. Feels as comfortable as a blanket.

Drinkability: No trouble at all here. I would gladly have another for sure but id probably opt for a pint instead of a glass.

On tap at DDC St-Jerome. This is a simple light black beer, well balanced with a surprisingly complex taste constituted in part with a nice subtle cocoa touch. I think it is a more "general purposes" black beer from DDC. It is lighter than most others black beers, and is not given up a lot as a compromise. In fact, I just enjoy it more because of that.
Tap @ OConnells Pours black with a dark beige head. Roasted, cocoa, chocolate aroma. Cocoa, sweet, roasted flavor. Well balanced.
I couldnt get much on the nose with this beer, but the flavor and finish is great. One of their best.

Draft @ ML Fontainas, 3ième fête de la St Jean, shared with Rlgk and _Angst_.
Brune foncée presque noire, col épais café au lait, le tout bien crémeux.
Arôme est malté grillé à souhait, avec un bon chocolaté en rétro et ce bouquet superbement bien rendu de stout anglais. Amertume fine perce en rétro-nasal.
Palais est malté avec de belles notes au caractère grillé, chocolat amer restant dans une approche de style assez anglaise.

Draught at Moeder Lambic Fontainas Attention Passage De Brasseurs 160623. Opaque black beer with a beautiful lasting beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, caramel, cocoa powder, raisins, some licorice. Dark chocolate flavor, coffee, tar, some raisins, some cocoa powder. Really nice stout.

Tap at DDC. Didnt take much notes. What I have written is: looks stunning, extremely thick mocha head with excellent retention and lace; extremely roasty and sweetish, cocoa and dark chocolate, the sweetness just enough, lovely soft and smooth on the palate. Must have it again.

Tap @ OHaras Freehouse.
Pours black color with a small beige head. Roasted aroma, chocolate, mild wooden notes, hints of coffee and subtle hops. Creamy chocolaty flavor, toasted malts, some dark fruit notes and mild bitterness. Balanced and very tasty. 
4325
En fût au Vestiaire. Stout à lazote qui nous donne ce goût crémeux et doux. Malt rôti et chocolat domine les flaveurs ressenti, le tout bien balancé.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 Draught @ William K Tennispalatsi,Helsinki. Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, burnt rubber, licorice, ash, mild hints of smoke. Taste is super smooth, mildly roasty and ashy with hints of burnt notes, licorice and coffee. Finish is smooth, roasty and slightly salty with some licorice, rubber and mild hints of smoke. Quite smooth.

Tap (William K Freda, Helsinki)
Lovely sweet soft smokey sausage aroma. Black, super persistent tight tan head (head still there 40 minutes after pouring). Lovely full smooth palate, so soft. Taste is a great mellow roast, but no astringency. Some coffee in the taste, some nice bittering hops too, this must have oatmeal in it, its so smooth and mellow. Finish roasty. Have I said mellow enough? Maybe not, as this is very mellow. 5% is a great strength for a stout, this is a perfect example.

Tap at bar hop. Pours a dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma is milk chocolate, hazelnut, light coffee. Medium body, light carbonation. Milk choc, light bitter choc, latte, vanilla, light treacle, light prune, hint of rum. Lovely balance, very tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 ounces on tap at Lagabière. Aroma: chocolate, coffee, roasted malt. App: dark brown almost black, thick moka head. Taste and palate: full body, creamy, smooth, moderate, fig in mouth, light dry bitter finish. Overall: awesome! Really smooth and nice fruity finish. Glad I took it.

Dégustée sur la terrasse du Vices & Versa en compagnie de Marco et Ju-Lo. Bière noire comme la nuit à la mousse crémeuse, onctueuse, généreuse et montée à la manière dune meringue italienne. Look absolument irréprochable! Le nez de cette bière est digne dun Grand Stout: une tonne de café riche et fraîchement moulu; le type darôme qui nous frappe lorsquon entre dans un café de Paris. Parfums délicats et francs de café-crème vanillé. Je ressens aussi beaucoup de fumée mais tout celà est parfaitement logique et cohérent. En bouche le liquide a un corps moyen et offre un goût de torréfaction complet. Encore à la manière dun Espresso, cest amer, plutôt court. Jaime le punch ajouté par la présence dune effervescence vivante et douce. En y regardant attentivement, je ressens aussi des fruits, tels la cerise et même un certain bleuet. Stout absolument délicieux, la Déesse Nocturne est un phare dans le style!

Draught @ Vices & Versa, Montréal. Pours cloudy very dark brown with airy but stable drak tan head. Clear aroma of roast and malt, with notes of chocolate and fruit. Bitter, roasty flavour, complemented by sweetish notes of malt and smoke and some etsery and hoppy notes. Hints of oats and coffee. Lingering, bitter and slightly smoky aftertaste. Decent stuff.

Draft at DdC with Linh, Paul, Ken and Nica. Pours a deep brownish black with thin brown creamy lacing. Aroma is rich earthy roast and some sweet chocolate. Mouthfeel is creamy and near perfect - this is so spot on for a non-barrel aged, non imperial, "regular" stout; balanced to perfection with wonderful earthy notes working well with the roast, chocolate and maple character. Subtle hop profile that delicately supports the earth and chocolate flavors. Great stuff - looking forward to trying this one again, preferrably on draft at the source.

New England Bucket List Trip #149. Keg at St. Jerome. Pours a dark red with a thin creamy tan head. Good head retention. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, maple, nuts, candied citrus. The taste is roasted malt, smoke, maple, mild herbal hops. Medium bodied, well balanced.

On tap @ Dieu du Ciel. Black with a big tan head. Very roast and coffee forward aroma. A lot of cocoa powder as well. A hint of spices. Flavor is pretty heavy on the chocolate. Big time dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Slightly bitter. Lots of coffee. Plenty of roasted malts as well.

Draft. Dark cola color with a very persistent thin tan head that leaves lots of lacing. Aroma and taste are both dominated by roasted malt and coffee, but there isnt much to balance it out so the beer comes across as rather bitter. Ok.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Arms Vasagatan Stockholm (backlog). Black colour with a beigeish brown head. Aroma is liquorice, mild toasted noted, toffee and quite strong chocolaty notes as well. Flavour is mild roasted malts, toffee, liquorice, chocolate and mild raisins.

Couleur noire avec quelques reflets brun et une belle mousse beige a lazote. En bouche je mattendais a un peu plus... Café,chocolat noir, pains grillés, vanille, manque un peu de corps... Correct...

On tap at Gainsbourg. Pitch black with a frothy tan head. Flavors are toasted bread, roasted malts, coffee and dark chocolate with burnt and resinous notes. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, velvety texture. Now thats a stout!

On tap in heaven. Pour is jet black with a thick finger of creamy cappuccino cap. Nose is smokey, with roasted malt, chocolate, coffee and a bit of earthiness. Taste follows perfectly with nice lingering bitter coffee and cocoa notes on the finish. So good!

Nitro tap at the brewpub. Déesse nocturne is pitch black with a thick creamy tan head and a soft cocoa aroma with roasted notes. A soft velvety mouthfeel that caresses you with  cacao, coffee beans, roast, vanilla & acrid dark malts but in a good way. Really nice flavor for just 5%

En fût au Saint-Bock. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka crémeuse et éternelle laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de malt torréfié, café, herbal léger. Goût de malt torréfié, café, cendre en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen. Un stout qui ne sort pas des sentiers battus, mais qui comme pratiquement tous les produits de DDC est très bien exécuté.

[ Keg, Nitro ][ 14oz ][ Dieu du Ciel Montreal ][ $5.75 ][ Nonic Pint ][ 5/26/14 ]
>> Nitro pour, beautiful thick nitro dark coffee foam. Dusty milk chocolate with strawberry nose. Taste is milk chocolate covered strawberry, cherries, mild soap. Upgraded Guinness with sweet strawberry with bitter dusty cocoa. Nice, but not my thing. High bitterness for style saves it. Doesnt feel thin. Very simple. With that said I quickly put away a pint with no complaints.

Dégustée en fût sur place à St-Jérôme (verre au coût de $4.25) le 28 juin 2009. Bière noire opaque. Col épais blanc crème, crémeux et très persistant. Légère odeur de café crème. Douce, assez sucrée, très amère en finale. Goût de café très prononcé. Savoureuse sans être sirupeuse, pas trop sucrée.
tap at the rewpub. solid. clean roast. bit of milky cocoa. potent clean roast character. tasty. dry. easy drinkin.
A very pleasant and surprising beer with a lot of flavors (chocolate especially) considering its low alcohol rate.
On tap. Black with tan head. Aroma mainly of chocolate, milk and mild coffee. Taste is of milk chocolate, smooth, nice,sone acidic notes.
Sample at dieu du ciel, one of the thickest and creamiest brews. Especially for a 5% stout, great stuff
Complex aroma of roast, chocolate, coffee and som tar. The taste is also complex with similar flavours. Not bitter, not sweet.

Draught at BAJT cons 2013-10-20 Göteborg
AR: wee smokey, dark coffey, chocolate, wee vinos
AP: dark black, frothy dark brown head
F: wee smoked head, dark chocolate, dry coffey, wee grainy, full body

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2013 Draught at porterveckan 2013.
Black with a small beige brown head.
Dark wine gums, licorice, chocolate, red berries. roasted, some fruity hops with light grapefruit in the finish.
Medium bodied.
Nice.
On tap at brewpub. Dark, slighly sweet, very roasty, a bit of hops. A really nice stout.
En fût à la brasserie. 5%. Azoté. Collet interminable. Nez chocolaté. Torréfié. Bouche: mince mais crémeuse. Très légère. Chocolat. Café froid. Bien.

Draught at Bishops Arms Savoy.
Pitch black coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweeta nd roasted aroma of dark chocolate, licorice and smoke.
Roasted flaviour of dark chocolate, vanilla, smoke and hops.
Roasted finish.
Aroma is all coffee and roasted barley Has a black black body with a light chocolate head. Flavour is heavy coffee and chocolate. Sweet mouthfeel. Its a decent stout

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 First ratingDraught at Bishops Arms Västra Hamngatan, Göteborg, on April 29, 2013.Black color, brown head. Sweet, herbal, minty, roasted taste. Roasted aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness. Sweet, roasted scent.Lovely, just lovely, I really hope I can drink this many times again.8/4/9/4/18=4.3RerateDraught at Bishops Arms Järntorget, on October 24, 2013.On tap during "Porterveckan 2013".Black color, smallish dark brown head. Sweet, cocoa powder, stinging nettles, chalk scent. Sweet, smooth, light roasted, raisin, vinous taste. Roasted, light coffee, dry, grainy aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bitterness.A lot less impressed by this than earlier this year when I first tasted it.7/4/7/4/15=3.7

Draft - So much coffee and chocolate with a hint of sourness.  Jet black with a thin brown head.  Tastes just like it smells with a hint of anise.  Light body very sessionable.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz glass on tap at the Underground Tap and Grill pours black in color with a light brown head that settles to leave some thin spotty lacing behind.  Aroma is mild with chocolate and roasted malts.  Taste is a chocolate malty sweetness with a subtle roasted grain bitterness.  Medium bodied with a mild carbonation.  Overall, this is a very nice tasting stout.

On tap at Underground. Creamy, oatish, 
Smooth choco, something red, flour, roasted marshmallows. T: roasted, leaves watery impressions on occasion, solid choco - smooth creamy and a bit on the dark side, yay. Pretty good and easy drinking.
Dégusté sur place à St-Jérome.Le liquide est noir et opaque avec  col épais et une dentelle qui persiste à saccroché aux parois du verre.Au goût grain noir, café .Facile à boire,une bonne stout.

On draft 01.20.2013 at the brewery with Andy, Ricky, PJ as part of Broquest Montreal 2013. Best feature here is the dark, sizable, hot-chocolate-looking head. A little dry, medium bodied, but not a lot of flavor. Easy drinking, but smells and tastes a lot like a Guinness to be honest.
Dark brown with a small brown head. malty and fruity notes. Malt, fruit and coffee. Medium body with a nice balanced bitter finish.
En fût au pub de mtl, robe noire et riche, collet épais et crémeux, arôme de café et vanille, goût de chocolat et de moka.

Aroma: Smelling of bread crust, dried dates, dark coffee and smoked meat.Appearance: A dark black beer. A brown head with good lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting sweet dark bread, dark chocolate, coffee, dried figs and some licorice.Palate: Low carbonation, a soft texture. A good body with a somewhat dry finish.Overall: Really well done stout, Dieu de Ciel delivers as always.Note:  Reviewed 2012-12-08.
Draft @ Nya Tröls, Malmö. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate and caramel aroma. Roasted malty chocoalte and caramel flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate finish.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 On tap at Vices & Versa. Again on tap at La Souche. Black with a medium creamy beige head and good lacing. Aroma of roasted malt with hints of chocolate and vanilla. Taste is the same but chocolate is more present and theres a slight to medium bitter finish. Creamy mouthfeel. Medium body. Clean. Not overly complex but extremely drinkable.
On tap at Vices et Versa (Montreal). Pours black with creamy beige head. Not much aroma. Taste: malt and slight chocolate. Drinkable. Ok beer.
Une stout riche pour sa grosseur avec une buvabilité morbide, probablement que lavoine fait parti de la liste des grains, bien rôti et chocolaté.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, pours black with a medium light brown head. Aroma of light roast, some oatmeal, very slight hint of bitter dry cocoa powder. Flavour of light roasted malt, oatmeal, and bitter dry cocoa powder, pretty much the same as the nose. Palate is thick, but the flavours are very, very light for a stout. Easy drinking for a stout. Great stuff.
Consommée directement chez Dieu du Ciel. En fut. Superbe arôme, superbe goût. Arôme de noix, Effervescence moyenne. Stout bitter exquise.

On tap at DDC. SO close to black, with a sliver of ruby lining at edges. Creamy, khaki cap. Roasted malt, dark chocolate aroma. Taste is the same but with walnut bitterness. Provocative lacing. Excellent stout.

On tap at Dieu Du Ciel - 03/03/12.
Inky black with a tan head.
Aroma composed largley of malts, coffee and a little chocolate.
Malty flavour, dark grains, getting more chocolate in the taste.
Medium bodied with a creamy texture - good easy drinking stout.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draught @ Oconnors. Pours black. No head. Super smooth and creamy beer with notes of milk and mint (in the clash with the herbal hops). Salmiak notes in the aftertaste. Well balanced and drinkable.

Tap at Bishops Folkunga.
Pitch black with short mocha brown head.
Straight but nice chocolate and coffee aroma with a milky tendency.
Smooth mouthfeel with very low carbonation. Sweet chocolate and bitter coffee flavour with a piney bitter end. Some caramel notes as well. Medium body. Very nice.

tastes like coffee, cocoa. Long sexy bitter taste and palate.  Sexy tracing that coats the entire glass. Ends up a touch sour at the end . Some cocoa and roast, burnt malt profile. I might even like this more than aphrordisiaque . On tap at DDC

Delicious.  Dark brown/black with ample and lingering cappucino-coloured foam.  Aromas are roasty barley plus coffee.  Smooth drinking.  Creamy, luscious mouthfeel.  Relatively dry.  Well balanced.  bravo.

Un classique de la maison revisité.  Un liquide profondément noir.  Une tête crémeuse.  Une dentelle.  Des arômes torréfiés.  Des grains brûlés.  Une certaine douceur.  Une touche de vanille.  Des noix.  Des saveurs qui présentent le meilleur des deux mondes.  Un côté sec et un côté doux.  Des grains de café très noir et une douceur maltée qui impose de timides notes vanillées.  Des notes de chocolat pur.  Une bouche très soyeuse.  Un pétillement qui napporte que du confort.  Une finale rôtie qui se laisse imprégner par une fine douceur.  Toujours aussi appréciable.

Tap. Moderate malt notes of toasted cereal and strong coffee, light herbs for the hops, earth for the yeast, with hints of charcoal and chocolate milk. Head is large, creamy, grayish-light brown, with an excellent %100 coating of lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is very dark brown. Flavor starts lightly sweet and lightly to moderately acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter. Palate is on the fuller side of medium, creamy with a soft carbonation. Simple in aroma but excellent in balance and a perfectly easy drinking Stout.

Dégustée en fût sur place à létablissement de Montréal. De couleur noire et opaque. Nez de café mocha, moyen malt rôti, léger de chocolat noir avec des notes de crème et des petites traces métalliques (azote). Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-bas et une texture crémeuse azotée. Léger goût de crème avec des petites notes de chocolat au lait sucré lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût de malt rôti doux, un léger goût de chocolat noir ainsi que des traces de sirop dérable et de toffee puis progressivement un goût de café sinstalle pour y dominer jusquen finale avec des notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût long et un peu sec, moyennement amer de café, de rôti, léger de chocolat noir et avec des notes de houblon herbeux. (printemps 2007)

From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy dark brown with a small, creamy and brown head. Aroma is roasted dark malt and light chocolate. Smooth malty, breadish, dark roasted, chocolate and light liqourice. Dark roasted bread and light acidic roasted note. Bitter and dark malty finish.

Draft at brewhouse. Very dark brown/black with a creme head. Aroma of chocolate and espresso. Body; very, very light ... almost flat (I am not a big stout fan). Taste of espresso for sure. It was good though one dimensional

Draught at Dieu du Ciel, Montreal. Very dark brown - almost black, average and mostly lasting light brown head. Moderate, malty and lightly sweetish aroma, roasted malt and light coffee. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, roasted malt and some coffeecwith light hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and lightly sweetish, roasted malt and some coffee, some bitter hoppyness. Lightly sweetish stout - not too sweet or not too much coffee. Nice one.

En fût au Bistro des Alpes à Gatineau. 20 oz. 5%. Couleur noire, très noire, mousse épaisse et CRÉMEUSE beige-brune. Arôme de café et un peu de chocolat. En bouche, de la vanille, un peu de chocolat et du café...du café et encore du café. Un peu de houblon. Finale un peu amère. Un divin nectar.

On tap: To be honest, this has to be one of Dieu du Ciel most inegal beer when it comes to taste. Most of the more recents offerings had this watery feeling mixed with green apples flavours, that I find a little bit annoying. On the bright side, creamy coffee notes remains, with dark cacao and roasted malt. Nice black robe and nice foam, helped by the nitro-tap. Satisfying.
Tap sample at DDC. Black, creamy dark tan head. Roasted malts. dry dark chocolate, coffee and a bit of smoke. Nice carbonation, slightly dry, little thin, bit 1 dimensional but still good.
Draft. Dark pour with tan head. Chocolate, sweet malt aromas. Flavors include caramel, licorice, chocolate and roasted malts.

On tap at the brewpub. A really nice brew. Pours a dark brown color with a thick brown head. A sweet chocolate nose, some smoke and roast. The flavor is great; roasted malts, vanilla, sweet, some smoke and ash. Very nice.
En fût au pub (9) - Bonne bière dans le style mais rien de plus à dire. Texture moins crémeuse que je croyais.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2013 on tap at DDC?s brewpub. it is pitch black with a 2 finger dark beige head. roasted coffee and a hint of burnt chocolate, but mostly coffee and a hint of smoke. body is full, low carbonation. very enjoyable, high drinkability for stout lovers.

Tap at the brewery. Masterpiece. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, and vanilla. Taste is sweet, with a bitter background, and very long length. Palate is creamy, and medium bodied. Black, the head if thickly frothy.

Aroma is all coffee and roasted barley Has a black black body with a light chocolate head. Flavour is heavy coffee and chocolate. Sweet mouthfeel. Its a decent stout, nothing spectacular though. Ninety-eighth percentile? Hardly.

On tap at Churchkey in DC.

Poured a very dark black with a pretty nice creamy tan head. Pretty decent head and some lacing as it made its way down. The smell was pretty one dimensional with some roasted character and faint hints of coffee. Taste is pretty similar, with a tad bit of smoke and coffee, but nothing too much else. After being thrilled by many of Dieu du Ciels other beers, this one just didnt have all that much going on. Mouthfeel was medium bodied with good carbonation. Pretty drinkable, but nothing too spectacular.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 03-12-2010

Sample at brewpub. Pours deep black with a voluminous brown head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of both chocolate and coffee - and the flavour matches the aroma. Tastes extremely deep for a stout of 5%...rivals higher alcohol stouts. Excellent.

Draught, 5% at the brewpub. roasted aroma, hint of smoke. Black colour. Big creamy stable light brown head. Whisky flavour. A bit smoked also. Does not taste as if it was barrelled, more like whiskywas added. But interesting.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, served in a tulip. Pours black with a creamy tan head. The head has great retention and leaves a small amount of lace. On the nose are notes of roasted and burnt malts, coffee, chocolate, grain, earth, herbs and grass. The flavour is moderately sweet, balanced against a coffee bitterness. On the palate, it is full in body with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a great stout with a chocolate and a slight coffee bitterness. It has a beautiful milky-creamy texture and nice hops. Another great stout from Dieu du Ciel. 2010-09-04

Draft @ DDC. Pours a deep black. Interesting almost peaty taste with strong chocolate and a smooth vanilla. Robust off-white head and moderate lacing. Simple and straight forward with uncomplicated roasted malt. Good brew.

Draft.. Jet black pour, thin beige head , excellent lacing . Huge roasted malt aroma , some coffee notes . Flavor is very roasty , chocolate and coffee .Medium bodied , low carbonation . Finish is a strong coffee bitterness . Decent

Pours black as night with a huge long lasting light brown head. Big aroma of roasted mats and a hint of chocolate. Rather thin mouth feel for a stout. Lacing is excellent in the glass. Flavors are well balanced. Nice stout.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in Kansas City. This kind of what I think of if I was in the mood for a sessionable stout. Came poured with a nice mocha cream head, and lacing that coats everything like the description seems to imply. Also, rather thick appearing for a lighter ale, and dark cola in color.  The balance of this beer is truly great, and just what youd want from this kind of stout. Lightly sweet roasted cocoa and nuts, cookie wafer, along with fruity hops, and pine. A very nice creamy mouthfeel through out. The finish is fairly dry with a good hop presence. This really was a wonderful and exceptionally balanced/drinkable stout.

On tap at the Flying Saucer in KC. Pours a black body with an inch thick, dense and creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is heavily roasted with lots of cocoa and a light coffee, yet keeps a moderate sweetness. A light bittersweet chocolate to this along with some dry, woody hops. Flavor is similar. Lots of dry roasts and cocoa with a moderate sweetness. The chocolate is dark and bittersweet with a subtle richness. Finishes very dry and woody with plenty of roast and a light coffee that gives it a lighter bitterness. I got a touch of licorice spice too. Lengthy aftertaste following a fairly light, very smooth body and creamy carbonation. Overall, a really nice stout. Lots of balanced, intense flavor in a lighter body and ABV content. Not ashy or burnt whatsoever either, which I really liked. I was impressed.
Nice grain and a bit milky, what Guinness ought to be! Cocoa and sweet coffee are soft.
Commercial description is about dead on with this one.  Great cocoa aroma.  Nice dry flavor with notes of cacao nibs and a creamy mouthfeel.
On tap at rattle n hum.  Kind o lf thought this was watery with chocolate, spice.  Ok

Tap at Rattle n Hum. Pours an opaque, dark brown with a sturdy beige head. Heavy aroma of roasted malts and coffee and some chocolate. Flavor is sweet with more cocoa and coffee. Medium bodied with average carbonation and a smooth, velvety mouthfeel. A bit lighter in body than you would expect by looking at it, which is neither a good nor a bad thing. Finishes sweet with light roast and dryness. Very tasty.

Sampled at the brewpub, in company of S8n on September 17, 2005. Pours a 1 inch thick and creamy tanned chocolat coloured head, with very heavy retention. Its colour is pitch black and the lacing left is sloppy. Light aromas of chocolate and coffee. A very creamy mouthfeel. Notes of chocolate and coffee also in the taste. Some bitterness in the finish, and, candy in the aftertaste. Very smooth, not too bitter, not too sweet and not too strong. Just, very nice. An awesome creamy stout that is very smooth and highly recommended.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel in St-Jérome. The color is black with a light brown head. The aroma is of malt and srtong coffee. The taste is bitter but not overdone with malt,coffee, some vanilla added. This is just a very good and powerfull stout.

On tap at Ebenezers.  Pours black with a large billowy tan head.  Looks like a beer float almost.  Aroma is nice for the style, with coffee, chocolate and anise.  Flavor is very good, really chocolatey.  Mild sweetness and average bitterness with coffee, roast, and some dark fruit notes.  On the palate, it has medium body, a fairly thin feel, and average carbonation.  A very enjoyable beer overall.

Draft. Black body with brown highlights. Tan, frothy head, slowly diminishing. Light  aroma of dark chocolate, roasted and burnt malts, nuts and pine. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes Lightly to moderately sweet and moderately to heavily bitter. Medium body, watery texture turning sticky in the finish. Lively carbonation. Surprisingly flavorful for the ABV  extra points for that. Tastes of toasted nuts, chocolate and vanilla. This stout avoids any ashy taste despite the burnt malt notes. The flavors are washed away by the carbonation, but the finish turns into a nice lingering bitterness. Drinkable and enjoyable.

On tap at Blind Tiger.  Black with dense brown head and lace.  Roasted coffee chocolate ash aroma.  Roasted coffee chocolate subtle dark fruit dry roasted woody earthy hop finish.  Soft palate.  Excellent.
A stout I drink everyday because I love it and its low on ABV. This beer is very good and I recommend this beer to every stout beginner. This beer is amazing with dark Belgian chocolate.

on tap at Dieu du Ciel. this is their version of Guiness. and what a fine job they have done! pours a pitch black with a thick, creamy moka head. not much going on in the nose, roasted malts with a bit of chocolate. taste is pretty much the same with the addition of some minor vanilla flavours. the mouthfeel is where this beer is at. it is medium-full, with low carbonation. creamy and sticky, it is absolutely lovely on the palate. an excellent stout, to say the least.
Aroma of coffee, milk chocolate and roasted caramel. Appearance was black with dark tan head. Flavor matched the nose with a dry hop finish. Palate was bubbly and creamy. Nice.

On tap. Pitch black. Thick brown creamy head. Aroma: deep chocolate, vanilla, a little whiskey and wood, somewhat muted by the head. Flavour: delicious milk chocolate bordering on dark, nice wood notes, quite a good alcohol bite with a superb creamy malt finish. Lovely.
Tap at Churchkey. Quite dry with a nice cracker malt, some roast, light coffee and milk chocolate notes. Very soft body with gentle carbonation. Excellent.
Bonne mousse épaisse, noir intense avec un goût de chocolat amère et vanille... une très bonne stout.
Pitch black with a medium creamy mocha head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malt and vanilla. Flavor is chocolate, soft fruity notes and roasted malt. Creamy mouthfeel.
Pours a deep black with a thick beige head. Smells coffee, mocha, toffey with hints of caramel. Creamy body with nice roast taste and a chocolate finish. Its smaching the Guinness all the way.

Glass, draught, at Dieu du Ciel!, savoured on December 4 2009; eye: black, opaque, nice chocolate milk head; nose: roasted malt, chocolate malt, vanilla, light burnt, coffee; mouth: roasted malt, chocolate malt, vanilla, coffee, finale in roasted malt with presence of chocolate milk, medium-full body, average carbonation, creamy texture, light acridness; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, en fût, chez Dieu du Ciel!, savouré le 4 décembre 2009; oeil : noire, opaque, belle mousse chocolat au lait; nez : malt rôti, malt chocolat, malt torréfié, vanille, léger brûlé, café; bouche : malt rôti, malt chocolat, malt torréfié, vanille, café, finale en malt torréfié avec présence de chocolat au lait, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyenne, texture crémeuse, légère âcreté; en résumé : très bon

[on tap at brewpub]
Coffee and slight dark malt banana aroma. Opaque black under a thin, lacy, tan foam. Smooth, slightly tangy vanilla with an even bitterness. Vanilla latte. Light to medium body, moderate carbonation, slightly bitter, tangy coffee finish.

On tap at the brewpub. A letdown after Aphrodisiaque, sure enough. But as a heavily roasted dry stout, with a big silky body, it nonetheless hit the spot as I tucked into my grub. Semi-harsh roast malts made it a tad one-dimensional, but on a chilly night it was rich, flavorful, and very enjoyable.
Black with a tan/brown head. Roasty chocolatey notes. Taste is dry. creamy body. A very good session stout.

Tap @ DDC. Pitch black with persistant head. Roasted malts come through in the nose and the taste uncovers some chocolate and malty sweetness. Mouthfeel is very creamy which is a plus. Straightforward good stout.

On tap at DdC. Nitro head. Very creamy. Subdued aroma. Not a lot of roast flavor. Nothing wrong with this, but not a whole lot stands out. It doesnt seem like the Aphrodisiaque is offered this time; a lot of stouts will disappoint when remembering that one.
Part of a sampler tray at the brewery.  Low carbonation.  Pitch black in colour.  Coffee and chocolate flavours shine through.  Very drinkable.

Pitch black beer, creamy tan head.  The aroma is great.  Loaded with cocoa and milk chocolate.  A great silken mouthfeel with a kiss of light vanilla as well.  Roasty and rich with a nice lingering bitter dark chocolate finish.  Lightly earthy bitterness.  Its pretty solid, really.

On nitro tap at Dieu du Ciel.  Pours a deep black with a monstrously thick (probably mostly the nitro which seemed a little high that day) tan to brown mocha looking head. Aromas of roast with hints of coffee, vanilla, and caramel.  Light lacing on the glass.  Creamy body, though a little thin.  Nice roast flavors.  Gentle bitter finish.  At 5% and tasty this is what a session stout should be.  Guinness could pick up some pointers here.
Draft at brewpub. Deep black color, long lasting tan head, roasty aroma. All of the previous coffee/chocolate reviews ar dead on. The hops give a nice bitter espresso feel. Awesome beer.
On tap at the brewpub.  Diet Aphrodisiaque by my account.  Mild with cream, coffee, and cocoa.  Has a subdued aroma and lacks in flavor.   This goes down like iced coffee.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2011 I had this one on tap at Saint-Jérômes brewpub right after an "Aphrodosiaque", wich I tought to be to strong in the vanilla flavour, although it is very well rated on this site.  In fact, every stout or Imperial stout brewed by Dieu du Ciel is highly rated on this site.  And, as a regular stout, I must say that I am thoroughly impressed by this Déesse Nocturne.  The taste is of bitter dark chocolate and espresso, with a long hop finale.  But what amazed me most was the thickness and the lasting foam on that beer.  My favorite regular stout brewed in my imaginary country of Québec.

Dégusté en fût  en format de demi-pint à la brasserie. Apparence dun noir intense avec une belle mousse. Arômes de grains maltés, de chocolat, de vanille, de caramel avec une touche amère et fraiche. Goût chocolaté amère avec un peu dhicory et de vanille. Ronde et crémeuse, un bon dessert!

On tap.   Pours nearly black with a nice cascading brown head.   Aroma is coffee, chocolate, roast.   Flavor is chocolate, coffee, hint of caramel, roast.   Palate is full bodied, medium to mild carbonation, finished sweet.   Very nice, simple stout.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2009 On tap @ Dieu du ciel. Aroma was cofee, expresso, chocolate. Nice big and thick brownish head. Finish was quite abrupt, texture quite creamy. Nice beer. Re-rate 091125. Nose is chocolate with hints of smoke. Some sweetness with notes of coffee. Overall quite discrete on the nose. Nice but a bit discrete. Taste is a bit smokey, chocolate, roasted malt. Finish is delectably roasty and chocolaty. Quite dry. Tiny hints of butterscotch. Palate is creamy. Nice beer ! Very drinkable. Nice session stout.

Pitch black coloured body with a deep brown head - once again, nitrogenated. Nice aroma of nuts, coffee and malt. Medium-bodied; Potent taste of coffee with some chocolate, all finishing with some malt. Aftertaste subtle yet refined. Light chocolate taste with a bit of malt finishes the beer off nicely. Overall, a very good sweet stout - once again, worth trying if you are out here and they have it on tap. I sampled this beer on draught from Dieu Du Ciel in Montreal, Quebec, Canada on 20-Fevrier-2006.
Une très bonne Stout, on sent tout de suite l’arôme de chocolat et le fort goût de cacao qu’elle laisse dans la bouche.

On tap, DDC.  Appearance is deep black with a still, tan head.  Aroma is sweetish with some sort of roasty malt/brown sugar.  Although the flavor is overall on the creamy sweet side, I also tasted some nice coffee, roasts and charcoal that provided great balance.  Finish lingers a bit, with some vanilla to boot.  Well crafted as usual, and not as far behind aphrodisiac as the RB ratings would suggest!
Draft.  Pour s dark brown body with little tan head.  Loads of bittersweet chocolate some coffee and a hint of fruit.  Dry finish and very drinkable.  Sweet.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2012 fût, drole de stout, couleur brune plus à la manière dun porter, très crémeux, mousse épaisse et brune, bouche un peu amère, ce nest pas mon meilleur stout.
Style et résumé: Un stout classique bue à plusieurs reprises. 
Comment: Un galopin bien assis au Pub. 
Description: Bière noire avec une mousse brune. Le nez est de grain brulé avec de la vanille. La bouche est ronde, grillée et facile. Il y a des gouts de vanille qui cohabite avec de la poussière. La texture est très intéressante.  
Note: 6/10

On tap. Dark brown color. I already had the Aphrodisiaque back in the days, and that one is a lot like it. This a a really creamy coffee ale, with roasted chocolate and coffee being the main flavor. Like someone said before me, maybe its because it was on tap but the taste didn’t seem as good the bottled ones. Good but not as good as peche mortel!

[1410-20080530] Tap. Biscuit cigarette malt aroma has a hint of dry toast. Black body with a long-lasting creamy mocha head. Cigarette smoked malt flavour is akin to sucking on a soggy cigarette. Medium body. Too roasted, too much cigarette, not a fan.
(@ Dieu du Ciel!; Montreal, QC)

On tap at Dieu Du Ciel. Pours black with one finger tan head. Aroma is loaded with citrus and fruit, more so than would be expected from the style. Cranberry , currant, and grapefruit chime in as well as some roastyness. Flavor is roasted malt with bitter chocolate,  apricot, and a host of fruity citrus from the hop end. Palate is a little on the thin side for the style, but nice overall. Unique offering for sure.

Jet black pour with a beautiful thick head comparable to peche mortel’s. Aroma has intriguing note of sour cranberry, along w/ a sugary sweetness, that add to the usual stout notes of coffee, cream, and chocolate. Fascinating flavor- fruity, with malt bitters in front and hops and citrus at finish. Thin for a stout, but fits the flavor well. Really good beer.

Roast chocolate with notes of celery seed or something a bit less pleasant for me--perhaps the hops.  Smooth palate.  Dark black.  A little lactic/sour at the end.  My least favorite DDC beer, I think.  (on tap at Dieu du Ciel, Montreal)
Black color with creamy beige head.  Mild aroma of roasted ashyiness, coffee and chocolate.  Taste is similar with more hops than a Guinness.  Nitro mouthfeel.  Dry nitro stout but well done.
great aroma of burnt coffee, and malt, with a nice sweet chocolate. Flavour is very well balanced between the bitter burnt roasty coffee, and the sweet milk chocolate. Wicked stout!

Draught (6 oz. sample) at Dieu du Ciel! Deep brown-black with a persistent tan head that leaves lots of lace. Fantastic aroma of dark roasted malt with notes of coffee and cream. Soft, creamy body. Flavour of dark roasted malt, coffee, and woodsmoke, with a well-hopped finish. Possibly the best nitro-served stout Ive had.

sampled on nitro at the brewpub.  Maybe it would be better bottle conditioned or on cask, but the nitro does whip it up and perhaps subtract from the taste.  Its a creamy tasty coffee, you must like coffee.  Cold coffee. Cofee aroma. Lots of lace. Very smooth.

3rd of 13 tasters.  Porus black with a half finger light brown head.  The nose was incredible, very intense, heavenly creamy, with lots of malt.  The nose almost reminded me of malted milk balls it was pretty sick.  The taste is astounding, it is a killer stout, intense robust and flavorful.

Nitro draft at the brew pub. Poured jet black with a creamy 1/2 inch head, pretty much what you would expect from a Nitro pour. Aroma of maple syrup, faint coffee, burnt malts and bitter bakers chocolate. Initial flavor is weak but as it sits on your tongue the flavor intensifies some with some burnt malts, bitter chocolate all tied together with an earthiness. Good stuff but how can you have a stout at DDC and even think that it can compare to the Nectar of the Gods Peche Mortel??
Engine oil dark with a dense tan head.  Coffee and toffee are present in both the aroma and taste.  A sliky smooth velvety stout.

Medium creamy beige-brown lasting head with a fringe of larger bubbles. Seemingly opaque black body. Faint milky roasty aroma. Sweetish dry milky licorice and burnt almonds taste with nutty metallic notes. Beautiful balance and very soft moufhfeel. Dry licorice, nuts, and metal aftertaste with strong burnt almonds character. Wonderful session beer; great stout interpretation. (0.275l draft.)

On tap at the brewpub, visited June 23 2007 with a big group of friends (no fellow rateberrieans though). In the dimness of the pub this looked black, with an almond coloured head. Rich coffee and chocolate malt aroma, same flvours on the palate, medium mouthfeel, dry earthy finish. A solid representation of the style, but nothing surprising in this one.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
UPDATED: AUG 21, 2010 Had this one again recently. Multiple pints, in fact. Absolutely drop-down gorgeous beer. Im not sure what I was drinking last time, but this was simply a perfect nitro stout in every regard. Super creamy body, rich but subtle flavors, only a hint of carbonic acid, roast and chocolate completely in balance, and oh so drinkable. 

(old rating) Dry stout on nitro. Disappointed with this. Aroma of roasty malts, light chocolate, marshmallow, chalk. Touch of roast, limestone in the mouth. Creamy, chalky, super dry. Guinness like, with no much depth. Befitting for the style, but dull.
Draught - pint glass.  I cant express how great it is that Dieu du Ciel is only two blocks from my place.  Not their best stout, but a very quality beer nonetheless.
a very nice stout.  nice full coffee/choclatey flavour.  nice head that lasts a while.  definitely a great beer to sip in Montreal in winter.

5 fl. oz. sample at the brewpub.  App.: deep, deep ruby mahogany with a very long lasting mocha head.  Aroma: plenty of smokey coffee and a sl. vinous woody quality.  Palate: med. bodied and very low carbonation.  Flav.: smokey chocolate, vinous, woody, coffee, lovely deep, dark flavours and a bit of cherry.  A little tart and a nice bitter chocolate finish.  Bravo!

Very nice lasting light brown head, lightkly cloudy body, very nice murky looking beer. Heavy malt flavors and aromas, toffee, butterscotch, smoke, brown sugar, semi-sweet chocolate, maple syrup... WOW... This is a 5% stout?... just WOW!

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2006 Draught.  At Dieu du Ciel.  Opaque ruby-black with a solid lasting tan rocky-creamy head.  Deep roast malt aroma, very dry with a hint of fruit.  Taste - light molasses roast malt, some plum and apple, the finish is ultimately quite mild.  Average to somewhat light stout body, creamy mouthfeel with light carbonation and a decently long malt/hop finish.  Quite nice, but not the mind-blower their other stouts are - very well-made.
Veyr strong. With an aroma of coffee. The foam is a little brown and sweet.

Draught at the brewpub. Pours black with a beautiful average size lasting creamy tan head -- gorgeous! In fact, Im quite impressed with how good all the Dieu Du Ciel! beers look. Very mild aroma of sweet malt, hops and...I dont know, it smells nice but the aromas very faint and hard to smell. Great flavour of coffee, chocolate, dark roasted malt, some hops and a bitter finish. Nice creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied. This is a great Stout, top-notch stuff.

On tap at the brewpub.  Thick, creamy, relentless, extremely appetizing head.  Dark black/brown color, aromas of coffee, chocolate, dark roasted grains/malts.  Flavors were similar:  hints of coffee and chocolate, but dominated by nutty roasted malts/grains.  A great, great stout.  Im not a huge fan of the stout in general but this brew was just amazing.

UPDATED: JUL 8, 2006 [tap @ the brewpub] Pure black appearance. Topped with a thick, whipped cream-like head. I wanted to just sit and stare at it for a while. Flavors are dark chocolate, subtle coffee and some serious roasted malt/chicory notes as well. Extremely smooth, almost silky texture. Finishes with some slight hops and vanilla sweetness. For me, this was the peak of my DDC experience. An incredible brew.

On tap at the brewpub. This poured with a black body and a light khaki colored head. The aroma was chocolate with coffee and some sweet vanilla. The taste was chocolate with a hint of coffee. There was also some anise.

A very nice stout from the pour forward. Great thick tan head - appeared to be on nitrogen - over top of a dark black stout. Coffee aroma that turned into a strong coffee flavor. The coffee analogy to Youngs Double Chocolate Stout. Enjoyable. Get it if you can.
On tap at the brew pub. Once again a very good beer from dieu du ciel. Dark color with a creamy texture. Great long lasting head. Bitter finish.
But sur place, 12 oz. Je croyais de lavoir coté, bon! Couleur presque noir, bon collet beige. Arome de café noire sucré. Bon goût de café mi-corsé et un peu amère.

Deep black color, with a creamy tan colord head, with dark roasted malt, roasted coffee beans aromas follow through on a medium-bodied palate with a smooth roasted malt character, with a black coffee, burnt toast notes,sweet cacao and mocha flavors, leading towards a roasted malt and lingering bitter finish.

On tap at the brewpub.  Pitch Black, very creamy beige head - looks about as good as a pint can get! Mild aroma - some roast, a little sweet, but rather disappointing.  Very flavourful nitro stout - tons of roast, dry, nice touch of bitterness.  Chocolate notes emerged as it warmed.  Mild session type stout - a perfect sipper after I stupidly walked up from the Eaton Centre in cold snowy conditions.  My first Dieu De Ciel!

[ Draught at the brewpub ; chilled ]

A mostly lasting average creamy brown head that tops up a hazy very dark black body. Heavy lacing. No visible particules. (beer is too dark to tell) Heavy filtration. Aroma presents malt being heavy burnt coffee/chocolate while hops are very faint earthy. Also, there are faint notes of licorice . Initial flavor is heavily acetic coffee and bitter chocolate while development is toasted bread like. moderate Finish is very long . medium body... but watery (?) intial texture that gets more rounded after a few seconds (thats wierd, i know) Soft carbonation...
My favorite when they dont have the Peché Mortel.

Pours opaque with a nitro-whipped brown head. The aromas have notes of dark chocolate, coffee and earthy hops. The body is just plain big. The flavors might be a bit one-dimensional wih really nothing out of the ordinary for a stout, the fullness of flavor is quite extraordinary. Tons of caramel and burnt toast round the beer out. The finish is very dry especcially considering the body. Great beer. Best nitro beer I have ever had.
A pitch black beer with a huge brown head. The aroma is sweet with strong notes of both chocolate and coffee - and the flavor is like the aroma.

20oz glass. Pours black with a khaki head, nitro? Roasted malt, coffee, floral hops aroma. Taste is sweetish with coffee, chocolate, and roasted malt flavors. Some milky notes. Mouthfeel is good, nice stout.
(draught) Deep black with lovely tan head. Roast malt aroma. Flavor is roast malt, coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits. Excellent stout.

Oh my!!!!!!!! What a great stout!!!!!!! Pours a very dark black with a very nice tan creamy tan head with great retention. Aromas of coffee, chocolate and very slightly fruity appear. Amazing flavors of coffee, chocolate and toffee seemed to come to mind as I sipped. Overall AMAZING!!

On tap. 

Aroma is roasted coffee, chocolate and nuts, black, medium sized coffee head, lots of lace. Flavour is espresso, strong malt and some hops. Well balanced, very full bodied, especially since this was draught, nicely bitter. Fantastic!

draught. pitch black body with a medium-sized mocha head. mild roast aroma with coffee essence. starts out creamy with coffee bean flavours and chocolate. very smooth and tasty. mildly bitter finish. I really enjoyed this.
Robe noire surmontée dune mousse brune crémeuse. Arômes de café. Saveurs de café, de caramel, de noisette. Amertume du houblon long en arrière-goût.

Bloody hell man - this is their "house stout!" Wish I lived in Montreal. Perfect stout appearance - dark black with a creamy tan head and great lingering lacing. Obvious roasty coffee prevails but there is some semi-sweet chocolate too. Chewy and creamy and some woodiness and vanilla appear. Very good.
Draught at the brewpubDark black, thick tan head, sheets of nice lacing. Nose of rubarb and soy, roast, light milk. The flavor is oaty, rich and creamy. Finishes a bit too dry but its good.

Tap- RBSG 05.  Pitch black with a thin beige head.  Aroma has some coffee with lots of roasted malts, and hints of toffee and chocolate.  Lots of chocolate flavor initially and has a big mouthfeel but then finishes a little wierd and a bit funky.  Some oak and wood in there as well.  I also got a bit of vanilla in the end.
On tap at the pub during the 2005 RBSG.  This is a very dark beer with a thin beige head and a dusty chocolate nose.  Bitter chocolate flavors with some vanilla and oak.  Very dry finish.

Nitro. Deep and dark, brown head. Lovely chocolate aroma, full, with notes of coffee and a bit of dark fruit. Full flavored, nice roast, chocolate and mild hops on the finish. Drinks far bigger than it ought to for just being a 5% beer. This was scrum-diddly-umptious.
Pitch black with a light brown head. Smells smoky. Tastes toasted, smoky, coffee taste. Dries me out.  More I drink less I like the aftertaste.  Took me Forever to finish 1 pint.

07.11.05  Tap at brewpub.  Black as can be with brown head.  Aroma hints at smoke, prune.  Rum raisin ice cream.  Excellent balance and use of body to get the flavor coating and pleasing the palate.  Light feel, not so potent, very mild hop-dry finish, not so roasty.  Light vinous presence to finish.  Very nice.

Thick Brown Creamy head.  Perfectly black.  Weakish scent (in a crowded bar)  Very thick very flavourful.  Bitter as sin.  Chocolat taste is a bit overpowering.  Rancid aftertaste.  Note - I am not a fan of Stouts.
Very Roasty smell and dark color.  Right bitter for a stout that is smooth and dry at the end.  Had this at Dieu Du Ciel, in Montreal.

Tap at RBSG05.  Roasty, chocolatey and slightly sweet, seductive aroma.  Opaque black color with a tan head.  Sweet, roasty, chocolate malts to start.  Lots of roasted chocolate in this one.  Finishes with a mild hoppiness.  Pretty dry finish, although its still drinkable and somewhat smooth.

Smooth, slick and cake-like coating on the glass, with dry malts everywhere engulfing the senses.  Creamy milk malt ball flavor with a very dry and chalky accent.  A good stout with very limited defects, but not very complex.
Pour was black with a thin dark tan head...smell was sweet chocolate and light vanilla...taste was sweet and dry chocolate...finish is slightly bitter...delicious...
2005 RBSG - Roasted malt, silky smooth, milky chocomalty.  Roasted & burnt malt, dark chocolate bitterness and sweetness.  Yummy.  A little thin maybe, but definately above average.

2005 RBSG Montreal Saturday. Black body with a thin layer of off-white foam. Chocolate and coffee aroma with lightly roasty notes. Chocolate and coffee flavours with a roasty and grapefruit bitter finish. Medium bodied, a bit thin.

RBSG 2005... Poured an opaque black color with a small, tan head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aromao f roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla beans, light whiskey, and dried fruits.  Taste of sweet chocolate, vanilla, and smoke, with a dry roasty finish.  Slick mouthfeel.

Verre de dégustation à la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de café et de chocolat. Apparence: Couleur noire opaque. Col moyen beige crèmeux. Large dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de café torréfié. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Corps moyen avec une texture crèmeuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût de café. (Rating #155)

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2005 Pours dark brown with average creamy top . Aroma got some roast and malt behind . Very clean and pleasant . Creamy , thiock bodied . Drinkable , smooth clean stout but lucking the depth .
UPDATED: APR 16, 2005 Dark, dark beer with a good tan head. Roasted coffee. Medium mouth feel. Well balanced.
Poured obsidian with a creamy tan head. Light roast aroma. Medium coffee flavor and some cocoa powder. Mildly bitter in the finish. Light carbonation. Slightly sour finish. Good.

Saved this one for last at my session at DdC. This is IMHO a mainstream stout. Well made, good ingredients but nothing stands out...just a good stout. Tapped midnight black with a cocoa meringe cap. Intense coffee/cocoa nose roated malt and some licorice. Silky mouth feel, charred/roasty body with cocoa undertones...hops add bittering that punches through in the finish. A good draft of this black elixer will set your day staright.

Nice aroma of mainly coffee and some chocolate. Great silky smooth texture. Flavor is sweet, creamy coffee. This stout is a great stout and incredibly drinkable. I was incredibly bummed that my montreal vacation started just 4 days after they ran out of peche mortel, but this helped out my dissapointment a bit.

TAP: Coffee and chocolate nose. Dark black color with a dark tan head. Roasted malt tastes with chocolate undertones, wood in the middle. charcoal-like bitter ened. Thinish body, but OK. The bitter builds on itself through the glass.

on tap at DdC, a deep brown, not actually black when held up to a light, the head was thick and creamy, tan colored and held up for the entire time i was drinking the other beers in my sampler (i saved this til last, then went back for 12oz glasses of my favorites).  aroma was coffee and licorice, with little tones of chocolates.  the flavor was opposite, with more chocolate than coffee mixing with the malts.  mouthfeel was a little lite, and the bitterness from the hops that came in on the end reminded me that stouts and sweet or imp. stouts are very different beers.

Dark charred-brown body, oily looking, and with its lovely little sticky tan head, I think I may have drunk the rest of the beers in my sampler more quickly so that I could get to this one sooner.  Very enticing.  On draught March 2005 at the brewery.  Smells of medium-roast coffee and some licorice, with a graceful element of hops in the background, nor is the subtle chocolate lost on my nose.  Flavor begins with dark chocolate and strong roast overtones, moderately bitter and quite drying to start.  But as it proceeds on my palate, some dark, lightly salty, rich black chocolate emerges.  Its as if I have left a piece of chocolate to liquefy in my mouth.  Roasty reprise on the finish.  Silky, milky creaminess, as expected, but I do have to agree with Kimchee that it thins out a bit too much on the end.

The sign on the wall was separate from the other beers. I believe that it said that it was cask conditioned. I might be wrong, I was just so excited to have found this place. It was nitrogenated which was a bit of a downer. Totally black with a thick creamy tan head.  Cereal and nutty aroma. Deep and earthy with a healthy dose of coffee. Rich bittersweet chocolate. Minty herbal hops in the finish.

Draft...This beer rocks!...  Who turned out the lights? I am sitting in very bright sunlight and I still cant see through this beer. Dark as midnight durning the new Moon. Its on nitro, so it has a large, creamy, tan head. Terrific retention with interesting, cumulus lacing. Malty, burnt aroma that is very chocolatey with notes of vanilla and toasted nuts. Tastes and feels like a dry stout to me and the 5% ABV is concurrent with that assumption. Burnt, but not overly ashen or bitter. Balanced, yet malty. Medium to full-bodied and very dry. Lengthy, burnt, moderately bitter finish. Excellent stout / dry stout!

Aroma:Black chocolate and cofee
Appearance:Black with a good creamy head
Flavor:Chocolate and cofee
This beer is a light sample of peche mortel very good.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2004 Sampled draught at the brewpub.
Very black with creamy head. Dry and intensely roasty with coffee and chocolate. Soft, velvetty mouthfeel and lingery grassy bitter finish. Tasty and well balanced.

Large lasting light brown creamy ale. Heavy coffee and toasted malt taste. A nice smokey taste completes the finish. This beer was a perfect example of a classic stout. The body was creamy, carbonation is soft, sweetness and bitterness are very well balanced.

Deep black color whit a creamy thin beige head. Powerfull and rich aroma of coffee with some chocolate. Amazing roasted barley , the roasty character is very strong, bitter finish. Thick body and a rich and creamy mouthfeel. Very good.
black, beige head.  caramel, roasted malt, coffee, and anise aroma.  the flavour follows but doesnt quite live up to the aroma and tins out a bit at the end.  Ive had way better from ddc.
Chocolatey black stout with a bittersweet palate.  Light aroma, wet body, dryish finish.

Draught, sampled on May 19, 2004.  A creamy, lasting, light-brown head tops this perfectly black stout.  Nice aroma of milk chocolate and moderately coffeeish notes.  The carbonation is soft, and the medium-to-full body is rich and creamy.  Dark, semi-sweet chocolate and roasted malts typify the flavours up front.  The finish brings increasing bitterness and a long, roasty aftertaste like unsweetened dark chocolate.  Very nice.

Black opaque body topped with a perfect creamy and lasting light brown head. Lightly smoked aroma of roasted coffee. Taste is definitely roasted and carries some hints of ginger and tobacco. Final is long and heavily bitter. This is exactly what I am expecting from a good stout. Keep the good work!
Pitch black and starts off promising, leading with coffee and continuing with coffee throughout, but still not impressive.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2004 Nitro beige headed chocolate body. Very light roasted chocolate aroma, rather coffeeish. Ultra-creamy body, coffee and milky taste. Solid roasted finish. There's one quality beer that I'm surprised I had never tried. Very well-made stout just like we've come to expect from master stoutie JF Gravel and most brewers would be proud to have this as one of their flagships and staple on the menu.
Deep black beer with a choclate vanilla aroma. Dark smoked choclate in the mouth with jsut enough bitterness...very rich mouth feel, leaving a nice enjoyable film in my mouth.
So good, one of my favorite stout. The head is nicely creamy. Smooth chocolate and roasted coffe beans taste.

Black, with brown head. Aroma was a little faint: coffee beans and chocolate. The flavour was well-roasted with a nice balanced hop profile, though maybe a little lacking here. Thick, full bodied. A good stout. Draught.
Dark Black beer served with Nitrogen. Good stout, with burnt caramel, coffee and nut.

Dark and opaque with a tan nitro head.  Lightly roasted aroma is somewhat passified by the nitro tap.  Body is sweet, but somewhat thin with a nice subtle dark fruit flavor.  Very smooth roasty finish as well.  A good, very drinkable stout.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2008 2008-05-30. Nice khaki head and lacing atop a black body. (4+) Roasty aroma with touches of coffee and hint of smoke. Very mild mocha. Flavour is much more bitter than I recall. Dry roast with unpleasant ashtray and bitter tobacco notes in the finish. Average palate is not the rich creamy weight I remembered. Odd. Hopefully this was a wonky sample and not a change in recipe. 7/5/6/3/12 - 3.3 Draft, Dieu Du Ciel, Montreal

October 2003. Black with a tan head, roasty and very coffee like to my palate. Body was decent but could be fuller. 6/4/7/2/14 - 3.3

Espresso head with black body.  Aroma is medium sweet chocolate, lighter coffee.  Taste is sweet coffee.  Think Breyers coffee ice cream, with a trifle more bitterness, and you've got it.  Creamy, fairly full body.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2005 Chocolatey and coffee aroma. Thin brown head with dense bubbles. Almost black opaque body. Big chocolate flavour with lots of roasted and dark malts very apparent but no astringency. Very full-bodied. A wonderful sweet stout. On tap.
A nicely made dry stour with a good raosted charcater.Full body helps hold up the creamy tan head.
Black. Creamy, light brown head. Rich, roasty nose of burnt coffee & bitter chocolate. Soft, thick, velvety feel. Complex flavour of dark roasted grains w/ lovely notes of sweet (milk?) chocolate.
UPDATED: MAR 25, 2003 (Draught) Pours a light brown head and a opaque, black body. Pleasant malt and cocoa nose. Strong Chocolate, molasses and malt flavours. Very smooth and creamy finish.
Black in colour.  Aroma of coffee and chocolate.  Flavour of licorice, roasty, smooth, creamy, bitter.  Soft mouthfeel.  Long aftertaste.

Embodies both the weak and strong points of the brewer's art quite well:  a weak nose (slight chocolate note) and a beautiful mouthfeel and thickness.  Slight roastiness, good sweetness, rather "light" on the tongue but memorable.
Easily one of the 3 best stouts Ive ever had in my life.  It is rich, complex, smooth and  has a depth of flavours.  Yummy stout.  I need to go back to Montreal.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2008 A night of coffee and chocolate maltiness envelops and soothes you to the very endA sensuous body, lip-smacking dextrins that know when to let go, as rich as it is drinkable for this size...This is a goddess I would pray to
